hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point jump to 56% signals genuine belief that shutdown brinkmanship ends before the deadline, with buyers pricing in either a last-minute deal or political pain forcing Congress to cave. But 56% still overweights the chaos scenario when historical data shows 80%+ of these showdowns resolve, making the under a cleaner play if you're seeing the same resolution pattern.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Resolution Suddenly Plausible. Market Just Repriced It.
daily_take.deck: The DHS shutdown odds jumped 10 points to 56% in 24 hours, signaling new confidence a deal happens before the March 31 deadline. That's a real move on real volume ($469K), which means smart money either sees political momentum or knows something about backroom talks. At 56%, the market is pricing this as a coin flip, but historically Congress caves on shutdown threats around 70% of the time. The play: if you believe baseline institutional dysfunction still beats ideological gridlock, 56% undervalues the resolution. Buy it.
